Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Alright let me try to tackle this problem step by step So Im looking at the task where I need to analyze a loan application process log and see if it adheres to the given normative and desiderata constraints The user provided a detailed description of the process the key constraints and the event log First I need to identify which cases are violating the normative rules The normative rules have two main parts strict sequence and ordering rules The ordering rules have several constraints including the sequence of activities the order of performing these activities and some specific timing recommendations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the events Ill go through each case and check if the activities occur in the correct order and if any of the constraints are violated Starting with Case 1 The application is received credit check risk assessment loan decision approved inform finalize documentation close case This seems to follow all the normative constraints The activities are in the correct order no contradictions and all timings are reasonable So no issues here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Next Case 2 This case starts with an application received Then theres a risk assessment but wait according to the normative constraints the Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment In this case the Credit Check happens after the Risk Assessment So this violates the ordering rule Additionally the loan decision is approved but since the previous activity was Risk Assessment this should have been the first step after Credit Check So this case violates both the sequence and the order constraint

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Moving to Case 3 The application is received then a Credit Check followed by a Loan Decision approved Wait but according to the normative sequence after Credit Check comes Risk Assessment So here after Credit Check it directly goes to Loan Decision skipping Risk Assessment Thats a clear violation Furthermore the Loan Decision is approved so the following step should be Inform Applicant but in this case the Inform Applicant is done after the Loan Decision Thats another issue Also after a loan decision whether approved or rejected the case should follow the decision logic which here isnt the case because after approved its Finalize Documentation before closing but here its just Inform and Close So thats a violation too

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Now looking at the desiderata section it mentions that while some actions are not serious violations they are considered desirable For example following up with the applicant and setting a follow-up call So any violation here isnt a problem but ideally these should be followed

Name: Inductive Reasoning - NE
Text: In the event log for Case 2 the risk assessment is done after the credit check which is a violation Also the loan decision is approved but the process moves directly to inform and close without following the decision logic which is another violation These are clearly incorrect and should not happen So summarizing Case 2 violates the sequence and order constraints because it does Risk Assessment after Credit Check It also violates the decision logic by approving without finalizing Cases 3 and 3a assuming there was another case violate the sequence and order because after Credit Check they proceed to Loan Decision without Risk Assessment and then do Inform and Close without following the decision Cases 2 and 3 also have timing issues Case 2s Risk Assessment is done more than 24 hours after the application and Case 3s Credit Check is done more than 24 hours later than expected and the Loan Decision in Case 3 is approved after Finalize Documentation which is not allowed I think thats all Now I need to present this in a clear stepbystep explanation
